item.title: Senate Republicans Alter Health Care Bill To Avoid So-Called 'Death Spiral'
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Senate Republicans have tweaked their Obamacare repeal bill in hopes of keeping more healthy customers in the insurance market. Customers who fail to maintain coverage could be temporarily locked out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Senate Republicans have tweaked their Obamacare repeal bill in hopes of keeping more healthy customers in the insurance market. Customers who fail to maintain coverage could be temporarily locked out. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534428929/senate-republicans-alter-health-care-bill-to-avoid-so-called-death-spiral

item.title: More Health Problems Reported With Hair And Skin Care Products
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Manufacturers are not required to tell the Food and Drug Administration about safety issues with cosmetics or hair and skin care products. That can leave people in the dark about health risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Manufacturers are not required to tell the Food and Drug Administration about safety issues with cosmetics or hair and skin care products. That can leave people in the dark about health risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/26/534411597/more-health-problems-reported-with-hair-and-skin-care-products

item.title: Cholera Hitches A Ride On The Backs Of Soft-Shell Turtles
item.description:
June 26, 2017 - A new study finds that turtles are really good at carrying the bacteria that causes the potentially fatal disease.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/533639747/cholera-hitches-a-ride-on-the-backs-of-soft-shell-turtles
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A new study finds that turtles are really good at carrying the bacteria that causes the potentially fatal disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/533639747/cholera-hitches-a-ride-on-the-backs-of-soft-shell-turtles

item.title: Secrets Of Breast-Feeding From Global Moms In The Know
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed. And try to. But only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why. And how to get the instinct back.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed. And try to. But only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why. And how to get the instinct back. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/534021439/secrets-of-breast-feeding-from-global-moms-in-the-know

item.title: Senate Republicans Have Their Work Cut Out For Them With Health Bill
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Senators could have another bit of information on Monday to help their decision-making. The Congressional Budget Office is expected to give its assessment of the bill's impact.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Senators could have another bit of information on Monday to help their decision-making. The Congressional Budget Office is expected to give its assessment of the bill's impact. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534377334/senate-republicans-have-their-work-cut-out-for-them-with-health-bill

item.title: What Women Should Keep In Mind When They're Thinking Of Breast-Feeding
item.description: June 26, 2017 - A majority of women say they want to breast-feed their babies. But only a small fraction reach that goal. Why is it so hard? Maybe the secrets of breast-feeding are in the past.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A majority of women say they want to breast-feed their babies. But only a small fraction reach that goal. Why is it so hard? Maybe the secrets of breast-feeding are in the past. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534368758/what-women-should-keep-in-mind-when-theyre-thinking-of-breastfeeding

item.title: Can Republicans In The Senate Get Their Health Bill Passed?
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Republicans and Democrats have different priorities for what the health care bill should do. Some Republicans have already come out against the bill and have said they won't vote for the measure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Republicans and Democrats have different priorities for what the health care bill should do. Some Republicans have already come out against the bill and have said they won't vote for the measure. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365607/can-republicans-in-the-senate-get-their-health-bill-passed

item.title: Avalere Health's President Is Concerned About Health Care Bill's Effects
item.description: June 26, 2017 - For reaction to the Senate Republican health care bill that was made public last week, Rachel Martin talks to Dan Mendelson, president of Avalere Health, a consulting firm.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - For reaction to the Senate Republican health care bill that was made public last week, Rachel Martin talks to Dan Mendelson, president of Avalere Health, a consulting firm. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365600/avalere-healths-president-is-concerned-about-health-care-bills-effects

item.title: Morning News Brief: GOP Health Care Bill, Modi To Visit White House
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Two GOP factions say they won't back the bill, and the Congressional Budget office soon offers an assessment of the bill's impact. And, President Trump holds meetings with India's Prime Minister Modi.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Two GOP factions say they won't back the bill, and the Congressional Budget office soon offers an assessment of the bill's impact. And, President Trump holds meetings with India's Prime Minister Modi. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365544/morning-news-brief-gop-health-care-bill-modi-to-visit-white-house

item.title: Where Does The Federal Budget Deficit Fit Into The Health Care Equation?
item.description: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget President Maya MacGuineas about how to balance the need for health care with the need to reduce the federal budget deficit.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget President Maya MacGuineas about how to balance the need for health care with the need to reduce the federal budget deficit. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/25/534332888/where-does-the-federal-budget-deficit-fit-into-the-health-care-equation

item.title: What Medicaid Cuts Could Mean For The Opioid Epidemic
item.description: June 24, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Lynn Cooper, director of the Drug and Alcohol Division at Pennsylvania's Rehabilitation and Community Providers Association, about the Senate GOP healthcare bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Lynn Cooper, director of the Drug and Alcohol Division at Pennsylvania's Rehabilitation and Community Providers Association, about the Senate GOP healthcare bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/24/534248650/what-medicaid-cuts-could-mean-for-the-opioid-epidemic

item.title: Federal Medicaid Funding Cuts Under Senate Health Care Bill Puts Pressure On States
item.description: June 24, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Julie Rovner, Chief Washington Correspondent at Kaiser Health News, about the Senate GOP health bill and what it could mean for programs funded by Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Julie Rovner, Chief Washington Correspondent at Kaiser Health News, about the Senate GOP health bill and what it could mean for programs funded by Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/24/534248643/federal-medicaid-funding-cuts-under-senate-health-care-bill-puts-pressure-on-sta

item.title: 'Interlaced Fingers' Traces Roots Of Racial Disparity In Kidney Transplants
item.description: June 24, 2017 - When Dr. Vanessa Grubbs fell in love with a man whose kidneys were failing, he'd been waiting for a transplant for years. Her book explores the ways racial inequity is embedded in the system.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - When Dr. Vanessa Grubbs fell in love with a man whose kidneys were failing, he'd been waiting for a transplant for years. Her book explores the ways racial inequity is embedded in the system. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/24/533966000/interlaced-fingers-traces-roots-of-racial-disparity-in-kidney-transplants

item.title: More Than Memory: Coping With The Other Ills Of Alzheimer's
item.description: June 24, 2017 - Many people with Alzheimer's suffer medical and mental health issues that have nothing to do with memory loss, including slow healing, incontinence, paranoia and depression.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - Many people with Alzheimer's suffer medical and mental health issues that have nothing to do with memory loss, including slow healing, incontinence, paranoia and depression. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/24/525887392/more-than-memory-coping-with-the-other-ills-of-alzheimers

item.title: How The Senate Health Care Bill Could Disrupt The Insurance Market
item.description: June 24, 2017 - In their Affordable Care Act repeal bill, Senate Republicans dropped the requirement that all Americans get health insurance. But they also kept the mandate that insurance companies cover everyone.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - In their Affordable Care Act repeal bill, Senate Republicans dropped the requirement that all Americans get health insurance. But they also kept the mandate that insurance companies cover everyone. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/24/534153075/how-the-senate-health-care-bill-could-disrupt-the-insurance-market
